pros: Good hours, an opportunity for overtime
high tech, great coworkers, good team work amongst staff
cons: short staffed, doesn’t pay enough for techs, hospital puts patients first over staff, HR is hard to get in touch with

job_title: Mother Baby RN in Geneva, IL
cons: Not the best salary out there

review_title: Patient care superb but declining; taking care of staff--atrocious
pros: Before the merger, there was a massive focus on positive patient care, use of evidence based medicine and adherence to LEAN principles. There was more than a sense of community--it was a family, and that nebulous experience flowed directly into the care patients received.
cons:
The merger was sold as a joining; just after the "join", the Board of Directors were split evenly, but the VP and upper management list was skewed (2 for Delnor, 14 for CDH). Afterwards, a slew of good people were forced out of their positions (they were offered early retirement, given a pink-slip if they didn't accept early retirement, or if a CDH and Delnor position was filled, Delnor staff always were cut). Job turnover is high in non-nursing areas (nursing had seemed to be shielded from the initial onslaught, but is now feeling the pressure). Whole physician practices have left the organization; several of those that have joined are bitter about having done so. The "Cadence Ax" of cutting people from Delnor has become so prevalent, that HR has a pre-made discharge packet in envelopes, ready to hand out to staff at a second's notice. Some Delnor employees are being let go on whims of CDH-management rather than on merit. 

Also, Craig Livermore has not been the CEO for quite some time.

pros: Great place to learn. Pay is ok if you are a new pct. great group of staff nurses. It's great for learning experience, but after that it get burning, you start to notice who's the cocky octane RNs.
cons: Crap management, charge nurses don't do anything when you bring up an issue. They do not help out with school schedule much. Always a new email with something to complain about. They brag about high hcap scores, but compared to other hospital that surpass them by 10% or more. It's all about politics. A couple of cocky RNs and pct. teach people!! don't shut them down, because they don't understand your policy or a procedure.

pros: Hard to think of any. No comparison to CDH. Benefits are ok.
cons: I transferred from CDH and biggest mistake I ever made. The department was so very unwelcoming and cliquey.  No one smiled or said a word to me. I felt invisible. I guess they are used to high turnover.  The PCTs are terrible. One found out I came from CDH and said "Oh you're from the mothership" very sarcastically.  I asked this sane PCT who was just sitting gabbing if she could call transport for me and was told I could do it myself. If you want to feel completely alone then work here.

review_title: Delnor hospital lab is a great place to work
pros: On the night shift, you get to be on your feet more to multi task different departments instead of sitting in one spot all shift. There's more time to talk and relax on night shift.
cons: For the night shift, we rarely ever have meetings, all we get are powerpoints to fill us in on what is happening. There's only 2 techs working over night, so the likelihood of workplace conflict increases.

pros: Good location, combined corporation has large cash reserves
cons: No longer has the community hospital feel; every area feels sterilized, like all of the personality is gone

job_title: Retail Food Service Manager and Catering Coordinator in Saint Charles, IL
pros: Excellent customer care at this hospital.  The staff is professional and they were grateful for the food service that we offered.
cons: The staff is very excellent.  Nothing negative can be said.

pros: Flexible along with great coworkers and a great company to work for. Especially which northwestern joining the company it has gotten better
cons: Not too many cons. If anything, I have heard that  someone people who have been there a while get preferential treatment. I personally never saw that but something to keep in mind

job_title: Front Desk Receptionist in Batavia, IL
pros: The benefits were most likely the best part, co-workers were decent and would help. Management was approachable.
cons: Workload was high at times, and patients could be rude. Too much focus on survey scores.

job_title: Patient Care Tech in Batavia, IL
pros: Coworkers, patients, hours, duties. I loved being a part of the hospital.
cons: Management, have to work weekends, have to work holidays. The management wasn't very good to the workers.

pros: great benefits, friendly staff, beautiful campus

cons: Terrible management.  Shows definite favoritism.  Harassment tolerated.  HR totally worthless and unwilling to help with documented harassment and blatant favoritism.
